Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.5pt">Operational Increases Offset the Additional Negative Impact of $0.11 Due to Unfavorable Foreign Exchange </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:9pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:14.11pt">Provides Updates and New Data for Select Clinical Programs Related to COVID-19, Inflammation &#38; Immunology, Vaccines, Oncology and Rare Disease on Analyst Conference Call</font></div><div style="margin-top:21pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">NEW YORK, NY, Tuesday, May&#160;3, 2022 &#8211; Pfizer Inc. (NYSE&#58; PFE) reported strong financial results for first-quarter 2022 and updated certain components of 2022 financial guidance</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(4)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">. Pfizer reaffirmed its previous 2022 revenue guidance, including its guidance for Comirnaty</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, the Pfizer-BioNTech SE (BioNTech) COVID-19 vaccine, and for Paxlovid, its oral COVID-19 treatment, despite unfavorable impacts from foreign exchange.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The first-quarter 2022 earnings presentation and accompanying prepared remarks from management as well as the quarterly update to Pfizer&#8217;s R&#38;D pipeline can be found on the Pfizer website.</font></div><div id="ida372ed6798f4cc1b9478f26be098937_4"></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">EXECUTIVE COMMENTARY</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Dr. Albert Bourla, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, stated&#58; &#8220;I am very proud of our performance this quarter, both from a financial perspective and from the standpoint of trying to be a force for good in the world. We continue to supply the world with Comirnaty, which remains a critical tool for helping patients and societies avoid the worst impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic, and we are on track to fulfill our commitment to deliver at least 2 billion doses to low- and middle-income countries in 2021 and 2022, including at least 1 billion doses this year. In addition, we are delivering on our production commitments for Paxlovid, which is already having a profound impact on the lives of patients. In response to the devastating war in Ukraine, and as a company that is </font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">- 1 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:54pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">dedicated to promoting human health, we have chosen to continue to supply the people of Russia with the medications they need, and are donating all profits from our Russian subsidiary to humanitarian efforts in Ukraine. We will continue to do all we can to support the health of all people, which is in line with our purpose&#58; Breakthroughs that change patients&#8217; lives.&#8221; </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Frank D&#8217;Amelio, Chief Financial Officer and Executive Vice President, stated&#58; &#8220;I am pleased to report another solid quarter for the company, highlighted by 82% operational revenue growth overall and 2% operational growth excluding Comirnaty and Paxlovid. Operational growth this quarter excluding these COVID-19 products would have been 5% if not for a 2% negative impact from losses of patent exclusivity for certain products and a 1% negative impact from fewer selling days this quarter compared to the prior-year quarter. We also entered the open market to repurchase shares of our stock for the first time since 2019. We will continue to thoughtfully deploy our capital in a variety of shareholder-friendly ways with the goal of maximizing the value we provide to all of our stakeholders, including patients and shareholders.&#8221;</font></div><div id="ida372ed6798f4cc1b9478f26be098937_7"></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Results for the first quarter of 2022 and 2021</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(5)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> are summarized below.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">OVERALL RESULTS</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:1pt;margin-top:9pt"><table Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">* Indicates calculation not meaningful.  </font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">- 2 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:54pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Beginning in the first quarter of 2022, Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> financial measures include expenses for all acquired in-process research and development (IPR&#38;D) costs incurred in connection with upfront and milestone payments on collaboration and in-license agreements, including premiums on equity securities, as well as asset acquisitions of acquired IPR&#38;D. Previously, certain of these items were excluded from Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> results. The change to include all acquired IPR&#38;D expenses negatively impacted Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> diluted EPS by $0.05 in first-quarter 2022 and had no impact on Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> diluted EPS in first-quarter 2021. In connection with this change, acquired IPR&#38;D expenses are now reported as a separate income statement line item and will equally impact both Reported</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> results. These costs were previously recorded within the R&#38;D expenses line item. Prior period amounts have been revised to conform to the current period presentation.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Also in the first quarter of 2022, Pfizer implemented a change in policy to exclude all amortization of intangibles from Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> income, which favorably impacted Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> diluted EPS by $0.01 in first-quarter 2022 and by $0.02 in first-quarter 2021. Prior period amounts have been revised to conform to the current period presentation.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Business development activities completed in 2021 and 2022</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(5)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> impacted financial results in the periods presented</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(6)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">. Some amounts in this press release may not add due to rounding. All percentages have been calculated using unrounded amounts. References to operational variances pertain to period-over-period changes that exclude the impact of foreign exchange rates</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(7)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">.</font></div><div id="ida372ed6798f4cc1b9478f26be098937_10"></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">2022 FINANCIAL GUIDANCE</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(4)</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Pfizer&#8217;s 2022 financial guidance is presented below. This guidance includes management&#8217;s expectations for contributions from the entire company, including Comirnaty</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and Paxlovid. It also includes for the first time a new line item for acquired IPR&#38;D expenses which, beginning in first-quarter 2022, are fully included within Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> results for all periods presented.</font></div><div 1pt"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The guidance range for revenues remains unchanged and represents 27% operational growth from 2021 revenues at the midpoint. In addition, this guidance includes the following reaffirmed assumptions for Pfizer&#8217;s COVID-19-related products&#58; </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Comirnaty</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> revenues of approximately $32 billion, which reflects anticipated operational increases offset by an unfavorable impact from foreign exchange of approximately $1 billion. This guidance includes doses expected to be delivered in fiscal 2022</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(5)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> under contracts signed as of mid-April 2022.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Paxlovid revenues of approximately $22 billion, which reflects anticipated operational increases offset by an unfavorable impact from foreign exchange of approximately $0.5 billion. This guidance includes treatment courses expected to be delivered in fiscal 2022</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(5)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, primarily relating to supply contracts signed or committed as of mid-April 2022.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Guidance for Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> R&#38;D expenses is being increased as a result of planned incremental investments in COVID-19-related vaccine and anti-viral life-cycle management programs as well as various other projects. In addition, a new line item has been added to financial guidance for acquired IPR&#38;D expenses, which will now be fully included within Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> results.  </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The midpoint of the guidance range for Adjusted diluted EPS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> reflects a 61% operational increase over the 2021 Adjusted diluted EPS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> of $4.06, which has been revised from its original presentation to exclude all amortization of intangibles and to include the impact of all acquired IPR&#38;D expenses. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The following table illustrates the main drivers of updates to financial guidance for revenues and Adjusted diluted EPS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> since the previous guidance update on February 8, 2022&#58;</font></div><div 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="border-bottom:1.5pt solid #000000;border-top:0.5pt solid #000000;padding:0 1pt"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Financial guidance for Adjusted diluted EPS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> is calculated using approximately 5.75 billion weighted average shares outstanding, and assumes no additional share repurchases in 2022. The expected increase in weighted average shares outstanding compared to 2021 of approximately 50 million shares has an unfavorable impact on 2022 Adjusted diluted EPS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> of $0.04 at the midpoint of the guidance range.</font></div><div id="ida372ed6798f4cc1b9478f26be098937_13"></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">CAPITAL ALLOCATION</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">During the first three months of 2022, Pfizer returned $4.2&#160;billion directly to shareholders through a combination of&#58; </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:40.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">$2.2&#160;billion of cash dividends, or $0.40 per share of common stock, and </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:40.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">$2.0&#160;billion, which was used to repurchase 39.1 million shares on the open market in March 2022, at an average cost of $51.10 per share.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">As of May&#160;3, 2022, Pfizer&#8217;s remaining share repurchase authorization is $3.3 billion. Current financial guidance does not anticipate any additional share repurchases in 2022.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">First-quarter 2022 diluted weighted-average shares outstanding used to calculate Reported</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> diluted EPS was 5,758 million shares, an increase of 96 million shares, primarily due to shares issued for employee compensation programs, partially offset by the weighted average impact of shares repurchased in the period, which resulted in a $0.02 reduction to Reported</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and a $0.03 reduction to Adjusted</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> diluted EPS compared to the prior-year quarter.</font></div><div id="ida372ed6798f4cc1b9478f26be098937_16"></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">QUARTERLY FINANCIAL HIGHLIGHTS (First-Quarter 2022 vs. First-Quarter 2021) </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">First-quarter 2022 revenues totaled $25.7 billion, an increase of $11.1 billion, or 77%, compared to the prior-year quarter, reflecting operational growth of $11.9 billion, or 82%, as well as an unfavorable impact of foreign exchange of $778 million, or 5%. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Compared to the prior-year quarter, first-quarter 2022 revenue growth was unfavorably impacted by approximately $200 million as a result of having one fewer selling day in the U.S. and one fewer selling day in international markets. This unfavorable impact is expected to reverse in the fourth quarter of 2022.</font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">- 5 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:54pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">First-quarter 2022 operational growth was primarily driven by&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Comirnaty</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> globally, which grew $10.2 billion operationally to $13.2 billion in direct sales and alliance revenues, driven by global uptake including pediatric and booster doses, following a growing number of regulatory approvals and temporary authorizations&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Paxlovid, which contributed $1.5 billion in global sales, driven by the U.S. launch in December 2021 and international launches in late 2021 and early 2022 following regulatory approvals or temporary authorizations&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Prevnar family (Prevnar&#47;Prevenar 13 &#38; 20) in the U.S., up 59%, driven by strong retail and wholesaler stocking of Prevnar 20 for the adult indication and favorable timing of government purchases of Prevnar 13 for the pediatric indication&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Eliquis globally, up 12% operationally, driven primarily by continued oral anti-coagulant adoption and market share gains in non-valvular atrial fibrillation, partially offset by the non-recurrence of an $80 million favorable adjustment related to the Medicare &#8220;coverage gap&#8221; provision recorded in first-quarter 2021&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Vyndaqel&#47;Vyndamax globally, up 41% operationally, primarily driven by continued strong uptake of the transthyretin amyloid cardiomyopathy indication in developed Europe, the U.S. and Japan&#59; </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Oncology biosimilars, which grew 35% operationally to $464 million, primarily driven by strong U.S. growth of Zirabev (bevacizumab-bvzr), Ruxience (rituximab-pvvr) and Retacrit (epoetin alfa-epbx)&#59; and</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Ibrance outside the U.S., up 12% operationally, driven by accelerating demand as the delays in diagnosis and treatment initiations caused by the COVID-19 pandemic show signs of recovery across several international markets,</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partially offset primarily by lower revenues for&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Chantix globally, down 99% operationally, which continues to be negatively impacted by a global pause in shipments of Chantix due to the presence of N-nitroso-varenicline above an acceptable level of intake set by various global regulators, the ultimate timing for resolution of which may vary by country&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Xeljanz globally, down 29% operationally, driven primarily by decreased prescription volumes globally resulting from ongoing shifts in prescribing patterns related to Janus kinase (JAK) class label changes and, to a lesser extent, unfavorable wholesaler inventory buying patterns and declines in net price in the U.S. due to unfavorable changes in channel mix&#59; and</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">Ibrance in the U.S., down 5%, due primarily to an increase in the proportion of patients accessing Ibrance through Pfizer&#8217;s Patient Assistance Program compared to the prior-year quarter, despite total demand for </font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">- 6 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:54pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times Reported</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New style="margin-bottom:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">* Indicates calculation not meaningful.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">First-quarter 2022 Cost of Sales</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> as a percentage of revenues increased 10.3 percentage points compared with the prior-year quarter. The drivers for the increase include, among other things&#58; </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">an increase of approximately 14 percentage points associated with sales of Comirnaty</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, which includes a charge for the 50% gross profit split with BioNTech and applicable royalty expenses, </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partially offset by&#58; </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">net favorable changes in the sales mix of other products, including the impact of Paxlovid and higher alliance revenues&#59; and</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">favorable impacts resulting from changes in foreign exchange rates.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">SI&#38;A Expenses</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> decreased 5% operationally in first-quarter 2022 compared with the prior-year quarter, reflecting, among other things&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">lower spending within Pfizer&#8217;s corporate enabling functions&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">a decrease in deferred compensation savings plan expenses&#59; and</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">lower spending within Pfizer&#8217;s Biopharmaceuticals segment, excluding COVID-19-related products, </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partially offset by&#58; </font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">- 7 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:54pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">increased spending on Paxlovid and Comirnaty.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">First-quarter 2022 R&#38;D Expenses</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> increased 16% operationally compared with the prior-year quarter, primarily driven by increased investments across multiple late-stage clinical programs, as well as additional spending on programs to prevent and treat COVID-19. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Acquired IPR&#38;D Expenses</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> are being disclosed separately from other R&#38;D expenses beginning this quarter. The increase in acquired IPR&#38;D Expenses</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> compared to the prior-year quarter was driven by an upfront cash payment and a premium paid on an equity investment in connection with Pfizer&#8217;s collaboration agreement with Biohaven Pharmaceutical Holding Company Ltd. (Biohaven), as well as a premium paid on an equity investment associated with Pfizer&#8217;s collaboration agreement with BioNTech to develop a potential mRNA vaccine against shingles. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Pfizer recorded $350 million of other deductions&#8211;&#8211;net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2) </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">in first-quarter 2022 compared with $1.0 billion of other income&#8211;&#8211;net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> in first-quarter 2021. The period-over-period change was primarily driven by&#58; </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">net losses on equity securities in first-quarter 2022 versus net gains on equity securities recognized in the prior-year quarter&#59; and</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:22.5pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.11pt">lower income from collaborations and outlicensing agreements in first-quarter 2022 compared to first-quarter 2021.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Pfizer&#8217;s effective tax rate on Reported income</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.15pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.85pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> for first-quarter 2022 decreased compared to the prior-year quarter primarily due to a favorable change in the jurisdictional mix of earnings.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"> R&#38;D Expenses</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="padding:2px 0 2px
